remarks: Property of the set of identities of ` G ` .  Either ` G ` has no identities, and ` O = (/) ` , or it has one and this identity is unique and identified by the ` 0g ` function.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Dec-2014.)
statement:
mgmidsssn0.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
mgmidsssn0.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
mgmidsssn0.p $e |- .+ = ( +g ` G ) $.
mgmidsssn0.o $e |- O = { x e. B | A. y e. B ( ( x .+ y ) = y /\ ( y .+ x ) = y ) } $.
mgmidsssn0 $p |- ( G e. V -> O C_ { .0. } ) $.
$d .+ x y $.
$d .0. x y $.
$d B x y $.
$d G x y $.
$d V x $.
